architecture.title: Architecture Overview
architecture.subtitle: Comprehensive technical documentation of the haex-vault architecture, components, and how they work together.

overview.title: System Overview
overview.intro: haex-vault is a Tauri-based desktop and mobile application that serves as a secure host for extensions (haextensions). The architecture is designed around three core principles: offline-first operation, end-to-end encryption, and extensibility.
overview.description: The application consists of a Vue 3 frontend communicating with a Rust backend through Tauri's IPC layer. All user data is stored in an encrypted SQLite database using SQLCipher, with CRDT-based synchronization to the cloud.

techStack.title: Technology Stack
techStack.intro: haex-vault uses a modern tech stack optimized for security, performance, and developer experience.

repositories.title: Repository Structure
repositories.intro: The haex ecosystem consists of multiple repositories, each with a specific responsibility.

projectStructure.title: Project Structure
projectStructure.intro: The main haex-vault repository follows a standard Tauri project structure with additional organization for the CRDT sync system and extension runtime.

dataFlow.title: Data Flow
dataFlow.intro: Data flows through the system in a predictable pattern, from user interaction through the sync layer.
dataFlow.diagram: User Action → Vue Component → Pinia Store → Tauri IPC → Rust Backend → SQLite

step1.title: User Interaction
step1.description: User interacts with Vue components. Changes are dispatched to Pinia stores.

step2.title: IPC Communication
step2.description: Stores call Tauri commands through composable handlers. Data is serialized for IPC.

step3.title: Rust Processing
step3.description: Rust backend validates, encrypts, and stores data in SQLite. CRDT triggers fire.

step4.title: Sync Orchestration
step4.description: Sync orchestrator detects changes and pushes to cloud. Other devices receive realtime updates.

security.title: Security Architecture
security.intro: Security is built into every layer of the haex-vault architecture.

encryption.title: Encrypted Storage
encryption.description: All user data is stored in SQLCipher-encrypted SQLite databases. The encryption key is derived from the user's vault password using PBKDF2.

twoPassword.title: Two-Password System
twoPassword.description: haex-vault uses separate passwords for local encryption and server authentication:
twoPassword.vaultDesc: Encrypts the local SQLite database and sync key
twoPassword.serverDesc: Authenticates with the sync server (Supabase Auth)

e2e.title: End-to-End Encryption
e2e.description: All data synced to the cloud is encrypted with the vault key before leaving the device. The sync server never sees plaintext data.
